intro: Silene patula var. longicilia, commonly known as the long-hair flax or woolly catchfly, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive, rugged appearance. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas. Silene patula var. longicilia is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, known for its showy, often colorful blooms.
